full_summary:
=================
### Tender Announcement: Request for Proposal - Custom Mirrors for SPIDERS and GPI Calibration System

#### Solicitation Number: 23-58221

National Research Council Canada (NRC) is soliciting proposals for the procurement of two custom off-axis ellipsoid (OAE) mirrors and one custom off-axis parabola (OAP) mirror for the Herzberg Astronomy and Astrophysics Research Center.

#### Project Overview
The SPIDERS project requires two OAE mirrors for its Subaru telescope, while the GPI CAL system upgrade necessitates one OAP mirror. Both mirrors are to be manufactured with delivery in Victoria, British Columbia.

#### Evaluation Criteria
Proposals will be evaluated based on the mandatory criteria outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP). Bidders must submit fixed unit prices in Canadian currency, excluding customs duties and applicable taxes.

#### Tender Submission Requirements
Submissions must be accompanied by a detailed price proposal, specifying the cost for each mirror. Validation of the submitted price is not required, but Bidders must provide a breakdown of the costs incurred.

#### Evaluation Process
Proposal evaluation will be conducted based on the lowest price submissions from Bidders meeting all mandatory criteria. Bidders are responsible for ensuring that their proposal adheres to all requirements outlined in the RFP.

#### Contact Information
Queries regarding this RFP can be submitted to:

* Wendy Semegen, Senior Contracting Officer
* Finance and Procurement Services Directorate
* National Research Council Canada

Email: [Wendy.Semegen@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Wendy.Semegen@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)

### Document Attachments

For a complete understanding of this RFP, please access the following attachments:

* [RFP-23-58221-EN.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tenderNotice/32586/23-58221---rfp lucr-m ediyor-oap péri.)

Submission Deadlines
=====================

**Bid Closing Date:** 2024-03-28

**Submission Guideline:**

All submissions must be received by the Contracting Authority by the deadline date and time despite the location. Bidders can review the technical details and requirements in the attached documents
